item.title: Positive definite matrices
item.description: Definition A \(n \times n\) symmetric matrix \(M\) is called positive definite (written as \(M > 0\)) if for all \(x \in \reals^n\), \(x \neq 0\), we have \[x^\TRANS M x > 0.\] positive semi definite (written as \(M \ge 0\)) if for all \(x \in \reals^n\), \(x \neq 0\), we have \[x^\TRANS M x \ge 0.\] A symmetric matrix is positive definite (respt.
